_header: God Thou have mercy of me
Subjects: psalms, penitential; paraphrases; Scripture texts, paraphrases of
_description: Eleven 12-line stanzas ababababcdcd each preceded by Latin text, in this unique witness with only the Latin and first two lines of a twelfth stanza, incomplete

BLAdd31042.First Lines: God þou haue mercy of meAfter thi mercy mekill of mayne…
BLAdd31042.Last Lines: …fflat me noght lorde fra thi faceAll if I falle in fandynge [exsa]le
BLAdd31042.Note: Ends imperfectly. Latin lines precede each stanza, the first, “Miserere mei deus secundum magnam miserecordiam tuam” (f. 102); written two lines of verse per line of the manuscript; end of last extant line partially illegible due to erasure or damage.
BLAdd31042.Facsimiles:
Thompson,  John J. 
             Robert Thornton and the London Thornton Manuscript: British Library MS
                Additional 31042.
         Cambridge: at the University Press, 1987: plates 20b-21a.

             Medium Ævum
         57 (1988): 38-55: 52-5.
Fein,  Susanna Greer. 
             “Haue Mercy of Me (Psalm 51): An Unedited Alliterative Poem from the
                London Thornton Manuscript.” 
             Modern Philology
         86 (1989): 223-41: 236-41.
